page.title: 18Schools in Mickleton
page.content: Richard Porter of Chipping Campden en- dowed a{parochial school}for Mickleton in 1513.In 1663 a schoolmaster was paid Â£20 a year to teach{the sons of {Mickleton's poor.}The room over the church vestry was for some time{a {school for boys only}.Girls were taught in{dame schools}.By 1857 boys and girls were being taught in the first two rooms of the present school. In 1870 a{School Board}was set up,and took over the school in 1871 from the Richard Porter Trustees.Gloucester- shire County Council assumed respons- ibility in 1902.After 1944 pupils were taken up to the age of 11+.There are now{97 boys and girls}between the ages of{4 to 11+ years}housed in the old buildings (leased from the Richard Porter Trust) and two temporary classrooms.No children at the school are bussed in from other areas.
